oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Non-innocent Additives in a Palladium(II)-Catalyzed C-H Bond Activation Reaction: Insights into Multimetallic Active Catalysts
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ANAND, M
SUNOJ, RB
SCHAEFER, HF
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: DINUCLEAR PALLADIUM COMPLEXES
CARBON-HYDROGEN BONDS
MILD CONDITIONS
MECHANISM
FUNCTIONALIZATION
ACETATE
ARENES
ALKYLATION
AMINATION
ARYLATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The role of a widely employed additive (AgOAc) in a palladium acetate-catalyzed ortho-C-H bond activation reaction has been examined using the M06 density functional theory. A new hetero-bimetallic Pd-(mu-OAc)(3)-Ag is identified as the most likely active species. This finding could have far-reaching implications with respect to the notion of the active species in palladium catalysis in the presence of other metal salt additives.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF THE AMERICAN CHEMICAL SOCIETY, 136(15)5535-5538
